intro: Chaetopogon creticus, commonly known as the Cretan hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its fine, hair-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It produces small, clustered inflorescences that are often overlooked due to its subtle appearance. Despite its modest size, Chaetopogon creticus plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
